content: this legal case involves two parties referred to as aa and bb who were former spouses aa filed a lawsuit in november 2016 seeking the division of their joint property which includes various assets such as properties vehicles and bank accounts the case went through the tartu county court which made a decision on july 21 2020 both parties appealed the decision but the tartu district court upheld the previous decision and dismissed the appeals the court also rejected bbs request to submit additional evidence the parties now have the option to submit a complaint to the supreme court within 30 days the court order has been entered into force the plaintiff requested the division of common property and compensation for the defendants unauthorized sale of property the defendant filed a counterclaim arguing for certain properties to be considered separate and requesting compensation for the plaintiffs actions that damaged a companys financial condition the court partially satisfied the claims and counterclaims dividing the assets and liabilities between the parties and ordering compensation to be paid the court also addressed the issue of procedural costs ruling that one party is responsible for covering them without specifying the exact amount the plaintiff appealed the decision but the district court upheld the county courts decision the district court also determined that the parties involved in the appeals will be responsible for the procedural costs with the specific amount to be determined later

metadata.cost: Each party covers own procedural costs, unspecified amounts
